Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Engler'], 'Producers': ['Gareth Neame', 'Julian Fellowes', 'Liz Trubridge', 'Nigel Marchant', 'Brian Percival'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Bonneville', 'Jim Carter', 'Michelle Dockery'], 'Studio': ['Focus Features']}
Review Text: My wife started watching the series a few weeks back and once it was finished she just had to watch the movie.  I mean..I kinda liked it.  I was never a fan of soap operas, but this one isn't half bad.
Review Title: Fine, I liked it.
Rating: 4.0

reference_summary:
The Fifth Element (Remastered) [Blu-ray] Bruce Willis (Actor), Gary Oldman (Actor), Luc Besson (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure ['Product Description', "New York cab driver Korben Dallas didn't mean to be a hero, but he just picked up the kind of fare that only comes along every five thousand years: A perfect beauty, a perfect being, a perfect weapon. Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Amazon.com', "Ancient curses, all-powerful monsters, shape-changing assassins, scantily-clad stewardesses, laser battles, huge explosions, a perfect woman, a malcontent hero--what more can you ask of a big-budget science fiction movie? Luc Besson's high-octane film incorporates presidents, rock stars, and cab drivers into its peculiar plot, traversing worlds and encountering some pretty wild aliens. Bruce Willis stars as a down-and-out cabbie who must win the love of Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) to save Earth from destruction by Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman) and a dark, unearthly force that makes Darth Vader look like an Ewok.", '--Geoff Riley'] {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, Luc Besson, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.25 x 0.3 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3350191', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 17, 2007', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich, Chris Tucker', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai, Mandarin Chinese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'} Looks and sounds AMAZING. Best experience with this movie I've ever had. Seriously a well done remaster. Looks and sounds AMAZING. Excellent Movie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Danny DeVito'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lazar', 'Peter Macgregor-Scott'], 'Starring': ['Robin Williams', 'Edward Norton', 'Catherine Keener'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Wife decided we had to watch this movie ASAP, so we bought the streaming version. Wish there was a BluRay version at a reasonable price, but I guess we'll be able to watch this again as long as it's available online.

Great movie. It's a classic - Norton is fantastic, and Williams is an absolute gem. Wish there was a BluRay {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Ray Bouderau', 'Courtney Chenn', 'Scott H. Dugan', 'Scott Fischer', 'Elliot Grainge', 'Grant Guthrie', 'Brent Guttman', 'David Haring'], 'Starring': ['Keanu Reeves', 'Alex Winter', 'Kristen Schaal'], 'Studio': ['United Artist Releasing']} This film is by far the best sequel a movie could ever have. Stays true to the roots of the originals with only a bit of retcon going on. Without giving anything away, the best character has to be Dennis. Wow...The whole family has been quoting this movie for a couple of weeks now. It's a must-watch if you're a fan of the originals. Such a good job. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** The user has a strong enthusiasm for movies, especially in the action and sci-fi genres, complemented by a profound appreciation for high-quality TV series with rich narratives. Nostalgic comedies continue to resonate, reflecting cherished childhood connections.

- **Media Format Preference:** The user prefers Blu-ray and high-quality remasterings but is open to streaming options when necessary, highlighting a commitment to an optimal viewing experience.

- **Rating Trends:** With an average rating of 4.8, the user maintains a discerning taste for outstanding storytelling and production quality. The recent interaction, where they rated a serialized content higher than expected, shows a willingness to engage with traditionally less appealing genres if executed well.

- **Favorite Themes:** Unique storytelling infused with adventure, fantastical elements, along with nostalgic and humorous narratives, remain significant draws.

- **Director and Actor Appreciation:** Originally aligned with directors and actors like Luc Besson and Bruce Willis, the user's admiration is now expanding to include talents such as Hugh Bonneville and a broader array of exceptional performances, signifying a growing interest in diverse storytelling.

- **Review Behavior:** The user shares detailed, positive feedback focusing on emotional resonance. Their reviews often highlight connections to family and nostalgia, indicating an evolving engagement with innovative content that carries the potential for cult classic status.
